summary: Truffles are a special type of fungus that grow underground near tree roots. They belong to the Tuber family and are related to other fungi like Geopora and Peziza. Truffles are important for the environment as they help trees absorb nutrients and survive droughts. Some truffles, like black and white truffles, are considered a delicious food and are used in high-end cooking in Italy, France, and other countries. People grow truffles and also collect them from the wild.
title: Truffle
